exceptions.exn: In environment n : nat f := fun (k i : nat) (ρ : mm_instr (pos n)) => match ρ with | INCₐ x => INCₐ (pos_nxt x) | DECₐ x j => DECₐ (pos_nxt x) (if Nat.eq_dec i j then 1 + k else if le_lt_dec k j then 0 else j) end : nat -> nat -> mm_instr (pos n) -> mm_instr (pos (S n)) g := fix g (k i : nat) P {struct P} : list (mm_instr (pos (S n))) := match P with | nil => nil | ρ :: P0 => f k i ρ :: g k (S i) P0 end : nat -> nat -> list (mm_instr (pos n)) -> list (mm_instr (pos (S n))) g_app : forall (k i : nat) P Q, g k i (P ++ Q) = g k i P ++ g k (length P + i) Q g_app_inv : forall (k i : nat) P (l r : list (mm_instr (pos (S n)))), g k i P = l ++ r -> exists L R : list (mm_instr (pos n)), P = L ++ R /\\ l = g k i L /\\ r = g k (length l + i) R length_g : forall (l i : nat) P, length (g l i P) = length P g_subcode : forall (k i : nat) P (j : nat) (ρ : mm_instr (pos n)), (j, ρ :: nil) <sc (i, P) -> (j, f k j ρ :: nil) <sc (i, g k i P) subcode_g : forall (k i : nat) P (j : nat) (ρ : mm_instr (pos (S n))), (j, ρ :: nil) <sc (i, g k i P) -> exists ρ' : mm_instr (pos n), (j, ρ' :: nil) <sc (i, P) /\\ ρ = f k j ρ' g_loops : forall (k i : nat) P, 1 <= i -> i + length P <= k -> mm_no_self_loops (i, g k i P) P : list (mm_instr (pos n)) R := DECₐ pos0 0 :: DECₐ pos0 (3 + lP) :: DECₐ pos0 (2 + lP) :: nil : list (mm_instr (pos (S n))) Unable to unify "exists ρ' : mm_instr (pos n), (?M1449, ρ' :: nil) <sc (?M1447, ?M1448) /\\ ?M1450 = f ?M1446 ?M1449 ρ'" with "exists l r : list (mm_instr (pos (S n))), R = l ++ (DECₐ pos0 0 :: nil) ++ r /\\ 1 + lP = 1 + lP + length l".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
n: nat
f: nat -> nat -> mm_instr (pos n) -> mm_instr (pos (S n))
g: nat -> nat -> list (mm_instr (pos n)) -> list (mm_instr (pos (S n)))
g_app: forall (k i : nat) P Q, g k i (P ++ Q) = g k i P ++ g k (length P + i) Q
g_app_inv: forall (k i : nat) P (l r : list (mm_instr (pos (S n)))), g k i P = l ++ r -> exists L R : list (mm_instr (pos n)), P = L ++ R /\ l = g k i L /\ r = g k (length l + i) R
length_g: forall (l i : nat) P, length (g l i P) = length P
g_subcode: forall (k i : nat) P (j : nat) (ρ : mm_instr (pos n)), (j, ρ :: nil) <sc (i, P) -> (j, f k j ρ :: nil) <sc (i, g k i P)
subcode_g: forall (k i : nat) P (j : nat) (ρ : mm_instr (pos (S n))), (j, ρ :: nil) <sc (i, g k i P) -> exists ρ' : mm_instr (pos n), (j, ρ' :: nil) <sc (i, P) /\ ρ = f k j ρ'
g_loops: forall (k i : nat) P, 1 <= i -> i + length P <= k -> mm_no_self_loops (i, g k i P)
P: list (mm_instr (pos n))
R: list (mm_instr (pos (S n)))

Goal:
(1 + lP, DECₐ pos0 0 :: nil) <sc (1 + lP, R)

Premises:
